import_expressvpn_exported_title.message: I have exported my password data

import_expressvpn_header.message: You can import your ExpressVPN Keys password data if you want to transfer logins between accounts or restore logins after an account deletion.

import_expressvpn_important_header.message: Important: You can only have one ExpressVPN Keys account per subscription. Please make sure you are signed in to the correct account before importing or it may result in duplicated logins.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step1.message: Sign in to the account you want to export from on your ExpressVPN app.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step2.message: Click the ExpressVPN Keys browser extension.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step3.message: Click the Options tab, then click Settings > Data > Export data as CSV.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step5.message: Click Export Password Data. A CSV file will be saved to your device automatically.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step6.message: Sign out of the account, then sign in to the account you want to import into.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step7.message: Click the ExpressVPN Keys browser extension.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step8.message: Click the Options tab, then click Settings > Data > Import from existing services.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_step9.message: Click on ‘…import from another ExpressVPN Keys account…’ then follow the instructions.

import_expressvpn_need_to_export_title.message: I need to export my password data

import_logins_1password_1pw7_mac_step2.message: Select the vault you want to export.

import_logins_1password_1pw7_mac_step5.message: Select the file format iCloud Keychain (.csv). If you do not see this option, make sure you are running the latest version of 1Password 7.

import_logins_1password_1pw7_mac_step6.message: Save the file to your device.

import_logins_1password_1pw7_mac_step7.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click Choose File.

import_logins_1password_1pw7_win_step2.message: Select all items you want to export.

import_logins_1password_1pw7_win_step5.message: Save the file to your device.

import_logins_1password_1pw7_win_step6.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click Choose File.

import_logins_1password_1pw8_mac_step4.message: Select the file format CSV (Logins and Passwords only).

import_logins_1password_1pw8_mac_step5.message: Save the file to your device.

import_logins_1password_1pw8_mac_step6.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click Choose File.

import_logins_1password_1pw8_win_step4.message: Select the file format CSV (Logins and Passwords only).

import_logins_1password_1pw8_win_step5.message: Save the file to your device.

import_logins_1password_1pw8_win_step6.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click Choose File.

import_logins_1password_import_limitatio.message: Important: ExpressVPN Keys only supports importing logins. Other data such as credit card details or saved notes won't be imported.

import_logins_choose_a_password_manager_.message: Choose a password manager service from the right and we'll show you how to import your passwords from it.

import_logins_contact_support_text.message: {import_logins_need_help}{import_logins_contact_support}, which can guide you through the instructions.

import_logins_error_incomplete_reimport_.message: Open the CSV imported in previous step in your spreadsheet editor.
Delete all rows except for those that failed to import.
Update the remaining rows based on suggestions on the right-hand side.
Save the file, then click 'Import Again' to import the updated file.

import_logins_error_number_of_failed_log.message: {TOTAL_BAD_LOGINS} of {TOTAL_LOGINS} logins could not be imported.

import_logins_error_total_failure_reimpo.message: Open the CSV imported in previous step in your spreadsheet editor.
Update the rows based on suggestions on the right-hand side.
Save the file, then click 'Import Again' to import the updated file.

import_logins_icloud_for_windows.message: iCloud for Windows does not offer an option to export your logins and passwords. You can do one of the following:

import_logins_if_you_do_not_have_a_mac.message: If you do not have a Mac, you can manually copy your logins saved in iCloud and paste them into ExpressVPN Keys password manager:

import_logins_if_you_have_a_mac.message: If you also have a Mac, install the ExpressVPN Keys Chrome extension to import your stored logins and passwords by {import_logins_if_you_have_a_mac_text}.

import_logins_if_you_have_a_mac_text.message: following the steps for our Mac instructions

import_logins_instructions_header_dashla.message: Important: ExpressVPN Keys only supports importing logins. Other data such as credit card details or saved notes won't be imported.

import_logins_instructions_header_lastpa.message: Important: You will need the LastPass extension to export your logins and passwords.

import_logins_other_apps_instructions_ad.message: Important: ExpressVPN Keys only supports importing logins. You cannot import credit card details, saved notes, etc.
If you are comfortable using a spreadsheet editor (Google Sheets, Microsoft Excel, etc.), you can import your logins by following these instructions:

import_logins_other_apps_instructions_hi.message: We're sorry that we don't currently support importing logins from your password manager.

import_logins_other_apps_instructions_le.message: Please [let us know which one you're using] for us to look into.

import_logins_other_apps_instructions_st.message: Export your saved logins as a CSV file.
Open the exported CSV file in your spreadsheet editor.
Delete any items that are not logins (e.g. credit card details, saved notes).
Delete any columns that are not one of the following:
Make sure the remaining columns are named like this (lowercase):
Save your updated file as a CSV.
Click Choose File below and select the file you just saved.

import_logins_safari_mac_step4.message: In the bottom left corner of the sidebar, click … > Export Passwords > Export All Passwords.

import_logins_safari_mac_step4_extra.message: If you do not see the … button, {import_logins_update_safari_mac_text}. If you still experience issues, click {import_logins_here}.

import_logins_safari_mac_step5.message: Save the file to your device.

import_logins_safari_mac_step6.message: Click Choose File below and select the file you just saved.

import_logins_safari_old_mac_step4.message: Select a saved password, then select Edit.

import_logins_safari_old_mac_step5.message: Copy the username, password, and URL.

import_logins_safari_old_mac_step6.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click +.

import_logins_safari_old_mac_step7.message: Name the login, then paste the username, password, and URL.

import_logins_safari_windows_step1.message: Open the iCloud Passwords app on your Windows device.

import_logins_safari_windows_step3.message: Click the copy icon at the top-right to copy your username, password, or URL.

import_logins_safari_windows_step4.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click +.

import_logins_safari_windows_step5.message: Name the login, then paste the username, password, and URL.

import_logins_safari_you_are_running_an_.message: You are running an old version of macOS that doesn't support exporting logins and passwords from Apple iCloud Keychain. However, you can manually copy your logins saved in Safari and paste them into ExpressVPN Keys:

import_logins_step3_bitwarden.message: In the left sidebar, click Export Vault.

import_logins_step4.message: If prompted, enter the password for your device. Click OK.

import_logins_step5.message: Save the CSV file to your device.

import_logins_step6.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click Choose File.

import_logins_step6_lastpass.message: In the ExpressVPN Keys extension, click Choose File

import_logins_step7_bitwarden.message: A CSV file will be saved to your device automatically.

import_logins_step7_dashlane.message: Double-click the ZIP file to extract the CSV files.

import_logins_step9_bitwarden.message: Select the CSV file to import your passwords.

import_logins_step9_dashlane.message: Select the credentials.csv file to import your passwords.

keys_not_included_hint.message: ExpressVPN Keys is not included with your subscription.

keys_not_included_p.message: If you have any questions, please [contact Support].

ksp_item_text_1.message:
Keys can generate, store, and fill your passwords across all your devices.
Plus, it’s included in your VPN plan.

ksp_item_text_2.message: Zero-knowledge encryption ensures no one can access your data, not even ExpressVPN.

ksp_item_text_3.message: Praised by TechRadar for “solid core security” and independently audited by Cure53.

ksp_item_text_4.message: [Bring all your logins] from Chrome, Safari, 1Password, LastPass, and others.

ksp_item_text_5.message:
Keys can store notes and credit cards, generate one-time passwords, and more.
[Learn more about Keys]

ksp_item_title_3.message: Secure by design, trusted by experts

ksp_item_title_4.message: Import logins from other password managers

options_modal_not_yet_available_generic_.message: Please try again in the future.

password_suggestion_avoid_dates.message: Avoid dates and years associated with you.

password_suggestion_no_need_for_extra_ch.message: No need for symbols, digits, or capitalization.

password_suggestion_reversed_word_does_n.message: Reversed words are easy to guess.

password_suggestion_substitution_does_no.message: Substitutions like "{'@'}" for "a" are easy to guess.

password_suggestion_uppercase_does_not_h.message: All uppercase doesn't help very much.

password_warning_common_names_are_easy_t.message: Don't use common names or surnames.

password_warning_dates_are_easy_to_guess.message: Dates are often easy to guess.

password_warning_names_are_easy_to_guess.message: Names by themselves are easy to guess.

password_warning_repeats_are_easy_to_gue.message: Repeats like "aaa" are easy to guess.

password_warning_repeats_are_slightly_ha.message: Repeats like "abcabcabc" are easy to guess.

password_warning_sequences_are_easy_to_g.message: Sequences like "6543" are easy to guess.

password_warning_simmilar_to_common_pass.message: Too similar to a commonly used password.

password_warning_straight_rows_are_easy_.message: Straight rows of keys are easy to guess.

password_warning_top_100_common_password.message: This is a top-100 common password.

password_warning_top_10_common_password.message: This is a top-10 common password.

password_warning_very_common_password.message: This is a very common password.

password_warning_word_is_easy_to_guess.message: A word by itself is easy to guess.

password_warning_years_are_easy_to_guess.message: Recent years are easy to guess.
